intro: Astracantha zoharyi, commonly known as the Jordanian thornvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy pods, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat. Astracantha zoharyi is often found in dry, scrubland areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
